ride.path

Class UniformityStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • ride.path.UniformityStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PathStrategy

    public class UniformityStrategy
extends java.lang.Object
implements PathStrategy
    This path strategy prefers a pickup station with more bikes available (depending on the type specified) and that is less than 5% further than the closest to the start point. It prefers a return station that has more slots available and is less than 5% further than the closest to the destination.
    Author:
    Pietro

      Station[] findPath(Point start, Point end, int bikeType)
      This method returns a 2-element array with the start Station and the end Station, according to the start and the end of the itinerary, and the type of bike the user wants to use.

    • Method Detail

      • findPath

        public Station[] findPath(Point start,
                          Point end,
                          int bikeType)
        Description copied from interface: PathStrategy
        This method returns a 2-element array with the start Station and the end Station, according to the start and the end of the itinerary, and the type of bike the user wants to use.
        Specified by:
        findPath in interface PathStrategy
        Parameters:
        start - The Point from which the itinerary begins
        end - The Point which is the destination of the itinerary
        bikeType - An int representing the type of bike the user wants to use. The value has to be one of the constants from BikeFactory (ELECTRIC and MECHANIC).
        Returns:
        A 2-element array with the start station and the end station.

      • findPath

        public Station[] findPath(Point start,
                          Point end)
        Description copied from interface: PathStrategy
        This method returns a 2-element array with the start Station and the end Station, assuming that the user could take any type of bike.
        Specified by:
        findPath in interface PathStrategy
        Parameters:
        start - (Point) The point from which the itinerary begins
        end - (Point) The destination of the itinerary
        Returns:
        A 2-element array with the start station and the end station.

      • findEndStation

        public Station findEndStation(Point start,
                              Point end,
                              Bike bike)
        Description copied from interface: PathStrategy
        This method finds the best station to drop the bike, assuming that the user is currently riding it. It is useful when the initial end station (computed at the beginning of the ride) becomes unavailable. It is also usefull is a user did not chose to follow an itinerary before starting his ride.
        Specified by:
        findEndStation in interface PathStrategy
        Parameters:
        start - The Point which is the current position of the user
        end - The Point which is the destination of the itinerary
        bike - The bike the user wants to drop
        Returns:
        The best Station for the user to drop his bike
